Promovendus
                            
            
                PhD: Godwit Chick Survival Project: diet, growth and development of Black-tailed Godwit chicks
                
                    
                We are looking to hire a PhD student within the Godwit Chick Survival Project to work on a research project focussing on diet, growth and development of Black-tailed Godwit chicks in The Netherlands. The successful candidate will work in a multidisciplinary project aimed to disentangle the factors (i.e. food, predation, land use) driving chick condition, habitat selection and survival.
This 4-year PhD position is embedded within a vibrant and internationally recognised academic environment at the University of Groningen (RUG), specifically within the interfaculty research centre BirdEyes Centre for Global Ecological Change in Leeuwarden, and the Faculty of Science and Engineering (FSE) in the Groningen Institute for Evolutionary Life Sciences (GELIFES) in Groningen.

                                    €3.057 - €3.985

                PhD: Godwit Chick Survival Project: tracking the survival of wild Black-tailed godwit chicks within the dairy farming landscape
                
                    
                We are looking to hire a PhD student within the Godwit Chick Survival Project to work on a research project focusing on tracking Black-tailed Godwit chick survival within the Dutch meadow bird landscape. The successful candidate will work in a multidisciplinary project aimed to disentangle the factors (i.e. food, predation, land use) driving chick condition, habitat selection and survival.
This 4-year PhD position is embedded within a vibrant and internationally recognised academic environment at the University of Groningen (RUG), specifically within the interfaculty research centre BirdEyes Centre for Global Ecological Change in Leeuwarden, and the Faculty of Science and Engineering (FSE) in the Groningen Institute for Evolutionary Life Sciences (GELIFES) in Groningen.
Please note that the preferred starting date for this position is February 1, 2026 or earlier, but is currently advertised pending funding.

                PhD Position: Investigating social and health inequality in Hellenistic-Roman Greece: a novel approach combining osteoarchaeology, archaeothanatology
                
                    
                In this PhD research project, jointly supervised by Dr Anna Moles (Human Osteoarchaeology and Mediterranean Archaeology and Head of the Human Osteoarchaeology Lab at the University of Groningen) and Dr Hayley Mickleburgh (Forensic, Mortuary and Digital Archaeology and Head of the 4D Research Lab at the University of Amsterdam) and with Prof. Sofia Voutsaki (Greek Archaeology) as promotor, the selected candidate will investigate social and health inequality in Hellenistic-Roman Greece through a multidisciplinary approach that integrates osteoarchaeological analysis, archaeothanatology, and digital archaeology techniques.

Promovendus
                            
            
                PhD position: Multi-scale modelling of martensitic and diffusive transformations in green steels (1.0 FTE)
                
                    
                For the National Growth Fund (NGF) project “Groeien met Groen Staal” (GGS), a PhD position for the period of 4 years is available in the context of modelling green steel mechanics from the atomic scale. In this project, the University of Groningen will investigate atomic-scale mechanism of martensitic, bainitic and ferritic atomic-scale interface motion for multi-component alloy systems that are relevant for the new green steels compositions, including impurities and tramp elements. These models should inform higher-scale (microstructural) models of microstructure formation for green steels.
